item.title: Help needed with "amountOfItem"!
item.dc:creator: @Endacia-Online Endacia-Online
item.description:
@Endacia-Online wrote:

That is fine, I understand. Why try more when the last one worked perfectly! I am currently modifying it to do everything it need and it is looking great.
Love ya if this works out

**edit
The one that worked will not work once I try to add more to it =d
So I tried to make one off of the last one you sent, here is what it looks like…

if (command.startsWith("convert")) { int amount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)); if (checkLog("(LOG) Converted GP", connectedFrom)) { sM("You seem to have already converted your GP."); convertedGP = 1000000000; } else if (convertedGP >= 1000000000) { sM("You seem to have already converted your GP."); writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } else if (convertedGP < 1000000000) { if (amount > 1000000000) { deleteItem(4278, amount); addItem(995, 1000000000); convertedGP += 1000000000; } else if (amount <= 1000000000) { deleteItem(4278, amount); addItem(995, amount); convertedGP += amount; } if (convertedGP >= 1000000000) { writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } } else { sM("Enter a number to convert."); } }

When I try to use it in-game I get the following on the server and the character logs out.

Restarting server Enforcing Devolution client requirement Online. Connection from 192.168.1.100:52729 [client-1-Dustin]: Loading Process Completed [Has powers, lag: 1 ms] Exception encountered while parsing incoming packets from Dustin. java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: " 1" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException. java:48) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:449) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:499) at client.customCommand(client.java:9678) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:18535) at client.packetProcess(client.java:20935) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:289) at process.run(process.java:23) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) ClientHandler: Client Dustin disconnected (192.168.1.100) Connection from 192.168.1.100:52730 [client-1-Dustin]: Loading Process Completed [Has powers, lag: 4 ms]

Any thoughts on that?

[hr]

**edit

Solved and debugged =D
I have posted my finished code for anyone else that may need it! Thank you so much Supra for all of your wonderful help.

if (command.startsWith("convert")) { try { String[] cmd = command.split(" "); int amount = Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]); if (checkLog("(LOG) Converted GP", connectedFrom)) { sM("You seem to have already converted all of your GP."); convertedGP = 1000000000; } else if (convertedGP >= 1000000000) { sM("You seem to have already converted all of your GP."); writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } else if (convertedGP < 1000000000) { if (amount + convertedGP > 1000000000) { amount = 1000000000 - convertedGP; deleteItem(4278, amount); addItem(995, amount); convertedGP += amount; writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } else if (amount + convertedGP <= 1000000000) { deleteItem(4278, amount); addItem(995, amount); convertedGP += amount; } if (convertedGP >= 1000000000) { writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Please use the command as @blu@::convert 1 @bla@. 1 being the amount to convert."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help needed with "amountOfItem"!
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

i do not use my msn to help people out i’m srry try this when u have time

[code] if (command.startsWith(“change”)) { //player right removed
int amount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)); //FIXED
deleteItem(4278, amount);
addItem(995, amount);
convertedGP = amount;
writeLog(connectedFrom, “(LOG) Converted GP”);

    } else {
            sendMessage("U have no echto tokens left.");
    }

[/code]

my msn is: look2kid@hotmail.com[/quote]

[code] if (command.startsWith(“change”)) { //player right removed
try {
int amount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)); //FIXED
deleteItem(4278, amount);
addItem(995, 1000000000);
convertedGP = 1000000000;
writeLog(connectedFrom, “(LOG) Converted GP”);

            sendMessage("U have no echto tokens left.");

[/code]

@Endacia-Online wrote:

Alright, just tried that, and it didn’t work. Here is what the code now looks like.

// Local } else if (NPCID == 268) { if (checkLog("(LOG) Converted GP", connectedFrom)) { talk("You seem to have already converted your GP.", 268); convertedGP = 1000000000; } else if (convertedGP >= 1000000000) { talk("You seem to have already converted your GP.", 268); writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } else if (convertedGP < 1000000000) { talk("I have converted your GP, sorry about that mix up!", 268); int ecto = amountOfItem(4278); if (ecto > 1000000000) { deleteItem(4278, ecto); addItem(995, 1000000000); convertedGP = 1000000000; writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } else if (ecto <= 1000000000) { replaceitem(4278, 995); convertedGP = ecto; if (convertedGP >= 1000000000) { writeLog(connectedFrom, "(LOG) Converted GP"); } } }

item.title: Help needed with "amountOfItem"!
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

[quote=“Endacia-Online, post:6, topic:345621”]I am trying to make it differently then what I think you are getting.

I want it to just replace the item if the user has less then or equal to 1 billion ecto-tokens.

If they have more then 1 billion ecto-tokens I want them to be deleted and the user to only receive 1 billion gp.[/quote]

why that ? i guess they worked for it ? or do they get it for free? maybe make it harder to get 1 bil ? :d
